meanings.definition: A line or boundary that encircles the waist.
meanings.sent1: She cinched her beltline to keep her pants up.
meanings.sent2: The tailor measured the beltline for the perfect fit.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer added a sparkly beltline to the dress.
meanings.sent4: The beltline of the dress defined her silhouette elegantly.
meanings.sent5: His beltline was a bright pop of color against his dark suit.

meanings.definition: A line or boundary that runs horizontally around a vehicle, separating the upper and lower parts.
meanings.sent1: The sleek car had a chrome beltline that added style.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic fixed the dented beltline of the car.
meanings.sent3: The beltline of the car looked like a racing stripe.
meanings.sent4: The beltline of the car gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The beltline of the car made it look more modern and sporty.

meanings.definition: A line or boundary that marks the top of a car's windows.
meanings.sent1: The tinted beltline of the car gave it a cool look.
meanings.sent2: The car designer emphasized the beltline for a sleek design.
meanings.sent3: The beltline of the car seemed to wink in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The beltline of the car framed the view perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The beltline of the car made the windows appear larger.
